title: Not reliable
comment: Many times after leaving a location WiFi does not disconnect.  Also sometimes forgetting a location it still connects when nearby.

title: Great app
comment: Does what it says on the tin
Awesome again

title: Just what I needed
comment: Does a good job.

title: Crashes on start
comment: A real shame

title: Wifi idle in unknown location
comment: I see this a lot when I'm waiting at a train station to go home. I cannot determine why the wifi keeps turning on at the station.

title: Puts one back in control of WiFi
comment: Smarter Wi-Fi Manager put a stop to unwanted auto-connect behavior with AT&T hotspots, and that one feature alone makes it worth buying.

title: Great idea if it worked
comment: Does not work learns networks but will never turn Wi-Fi on off. They should have a trail version so one can determine this before wasting 3.00 as I did. Do not buy. Drains battery fast to

title: Doesn't Work on stock HTC One M8
comment: WiFi enabled too often (constantly on in learning mode) to recognize any battery saving or security/ privacy benefits. Actually creates a vulnerability by forcing Wi-Fi enabled even after manually disabling it.  Great concept but worthless implementation!

title: Great App for managing Wi-Fi and Bluetooth
comment: I've tried several different apps for managing my phone connections to  WiFi networks and Bluetooth devices and this is the best app available. First it is based on open source code which gives me confident there is no spyware included. Second it is easy to configure.

title: Great for privacy and battery savings
comment: Easy to set up. Love that WiFi is re-enabled automatically when I get home and to work and turned off elsewhere. Coordination between Bluetooth and WiFi is smart too. Updated frequently - UI issue in L has already been fixed.

title: Enhances privacy
comment: This is a great privacy enhancement. It can be a little awkward some times, but that's too be expected. Generally works well.

title: Disappointing
comment: I'm disappointed that the WiFi and Bluetooth radios can be controlled, but not the provider data radio. it doesn't seem to remember cell phone towers either, that's misleading, not that there's much value in referencing the tower.

title: Not working on Lollipop on N5
comment: Can't toggle switches. Worked great before.

title: Hmmm
comment: Time option doesn't work.

title: Doesn't Work
comment: I turn on location learning & it finds some identifying cell towers. I disable learning,  leave,  & Wifi is turned off as it should be.  However when I return Wifi isn't enabled & I must turn it on to use it.  Plain out doesn't work on Nexus 4.
Requires too much handholding. Constantly turning on in unknown areas.

title: Time mode doesn't work
comment: For me time mode does not work.  I have two items set - disable WiFi at 12:00 AM - 8:00 AM and disable Bluetooth 1:00 AM - 8:00 AM.  Checking at 2:00 am WiFi was On.  Bluetooth was off.  Then at 9:00 am bluetooth was still off.  So it did not turn WiFI off at 12:00 am and did not turn bluetooth back on at 8:00 am.  Too bad since this app has some very useful features.

title: Does what it claims to do
comment: The single most annoying problem for me on a phone is having wifi turned on and constantly trying to connect to unwanted networks. This forces me to always toggle wifi on and off which by itself is obnoxious when your trying to use data not wifi. It also tends to lead to one using data when at home. This works seamlessly to do the job for you.

title: Actually helps save battery life!
comment: It works like it says, you will notice a better battery life.

title: For the security conscious
comment: Does a great job of neutralizing a common threat.

title: Security
comment: Upgrade

title: Only remembers 3 locations
comment: The app only seems to remember three distinct locations.  I certainly have more than three trusted networks I connect to on a regular basis.  Is this limit part of the app's spec., or am I seeing a bug?

title: Intelligent & well-designed.
comment: You can stop worrying. Does one (complex) thing well.

title: Almost great
comment: On a Nexus 5. Keeps disabling my mobile data connection when it turns off my WiFi. I then have to toggle airplane mode to bring it back.

title: breaks gps location
comment: it turns wifi off when it is manually turned on to assist in quicker positioning. Quite annoying

title: Smarter Wi-Fi Manager
comment: Make ur life simplistic with a Wi-Fi manager that works

title: Wi-Fi always on
comment: Not working. Configuration seems right, but I have to manually press forget network for it to turn off Wi-Fi. Galaxy Nexus 4.4.4 Cyanogen  *update: seems to be working now. One minor problem is that when I toggle wifi off at a trusted location, it gets turned back on automatically.

title: Outstanding
comment: This app does exactly what it says.  It keeps your Wi-Fi off when it is not in a known location, and seamlessly turns it back on when you are I in an area where it had learned you use Wi-Fi.  Great for keeping tracking via Wi-Fi to a minimum, and potentially helping battery life (if your device's Wi-Fi uses a lot of battery).  Works as designed.

title: Broken
comment: Isn't learning any networks on Nexus 5. Can't get this to work at all.
P.S: I can never easily find this app on the store because of the "-" in "Wi-Fi".

title: Not just there yet
comment: This app learns locations bases on cell tower identities. Now the phone tries to connect to other wifi networks in the same location, for instance the open network of a nearby shop.  I bought this app to prevent shop owners from wifi-tracking me. But in these circumstances they still can.

title: Won't turn on anymore.
comment: This app seemed to work fine for a while, but I started having difficulty turning it off or manually overriding it.  Last night I turned it off and now I can't turn it back on.  I keep running the app and telling it to manage the WiFi, but the the ongoing task always reports that the radio is not being managed.  I have no idea how to troubleshoot this so I uninstalled.
Great app does exactly what it says. The ability to disable bluetooth when connected to specific wifi networks would make this great app perfect.

title: Does what it says on the tin
comment: This is a great way to save battery life and maintain privacy by tying your radio state to known locations.

title: Not working correctly
comment: This app SHOULD automatically learn the area where my WiFis are actually in range. However, it simply keeps accumulating towers for those WiFis and therefore doesn't turn off the WiFi. Additionally, it does not offer any setting for a timeout (i.e. when you are near a WiFi but not close enough to be in range, it SHOULD actually disable WiFi after some time, but does not do so).

title: Samsung Galaxy S
comment: I bought the app from google play store but can't use it on my Samsung Galaxy S , This is an older phone now but when you try to load the program it says it has shut down unexpectedly and asks if you would like to submit a crash report, when you try to do that it then tells you that google play store has crash unexpectedly as well. I have not tried compiling it from source yet but it does not work when downloaded from the google app store.  It really looks like a great app too , so I was disappointed to buy it and not be able to use it.

title: So far so good
comment: But I really need to manually turn off wifi at times, and the app just won't let me do that. It just keeps on relearning spots over and over again, unless ignored, and it still won't let me manually turn off wifi. But constantly relearning the same connection until actively ignored, but not removed...

You can force it off with the quick-settings panel (select the notification).  You can also tell it to blacklist specific SSIDs so it won't learn when you're connected to them - it will just ignore them and you can turn Wi-Fi on or off manually near them.  The easiest is probably the quick settings, however.

title: Another Great App
comment: Love dragorns work on kismet .. and this tool really knocks it out of the park for managing wireless

title: This just works ... worth every penny!
comment: Keep your phone safe from WiFi risks and tracking by auto shutdown of WiFi when you are away from safe networks.

title: Excellent idea and execution
comment: Works perfectly on all my devices; looking forward to seeing were the app goes in the future.

title: Works well
comment: Does what it is suppose to do. No problems.

title: not just another wifi manager
comment: The author of this app is one of the foremost experts of wireless technology and security and I'd buy anything he wrote. Finally a solution that doesn't require GPS!

title: Excellent app
comment: Works as advertised advertised. Worth every penny

title: Excellent Application
comment: Really enjoying this app. Setup and configuration is minimal, all you really have to do is manually enable Wi-Fi a few times to let it learn networks and locations. After that, it's completely automatic.   Adheres to Holo theming and Android usage guidelines, so it looks very slick and clean. Excellent app, totally worth $2.99!

title: Does what it's supposed to.
comment: Works nicely, not had any  problems.

title: Great idea, but frustrating usage
comment: I love the idea of this app. It makes sense and should save battery. Although, in practice, I am constantly battling it to get WiFi to stay on, even in "learned" areas. Seems to me that when learning, the app should be more promiscuous, or use geo-fencing temporarily to learn the areas towers. I also noticed that since I'm battling the manager, I use more battery from screen time and WiFi being turned on and off.

If you find it turning off Wi-Fi before you've configured it, you can extend the time delay in the preferences.

Please feel free to join the beta program (linked off the SWM website); if you can report problems there we can work on fixing them directly.

title: Much better then y5!
comment: I used y5 in the past and found it lacking in feature set and very obtrusive. SWM works much better and stays out of my way.

title: Interesting
comment: Looks promising.

title: was: Didn't work on my XT907
comment: Heavily modified review, with upgraded stars.  After it kept disconnecting my wifi, I turned it off (well, disabled it's management of my WiFi).  later, I restarted my phone, and now it appears to be acting appropriately, so I'll give it 4 stars, because this could be quite awesome.

Sorry about that - it's fixed in the .12 release which got posted to the market about 20 minutes after I first posted the releases to twitter, but took a while to filter through.  Both of these problems are addressed; Hope it works better for you now!

title: Does as advertised
comment: First version installed this morning was crashing when accessing "Settings" menu and doesn't allow me to manually turn on wifi when changing locations. For instance app learned my work location but when I arrived at home wouldn't allow me to turn on wifi to learn new location. Had to disable Manage wifi within app to enable my home network and then re-enable.  UPDATE : Developer released a new version and behavior was corrected.

title: Works wonderfully
comment: Awaiting the new features that are around the corner, but this works far more intelligently than other similar solutions. Plus, it's written by the man who knows wifi like none other! Hail to the king baby!

title: Does Exactly What It Says On The Tin
comment: Shuts off WiFi and turns it back on just as it says it's going to.  Smart enough to work across an entire college campus with the same SSID.  No stupid ads or internet privs requested and configuration is simple.
